Comments_List: Techniques for proving statements about random graphs. I also learned that I need knowledge of (deterministic) graphs in order to study random graphs.
Probability, manipulating inequalities and starting to develop an instinct for how probabilistic graph properties behave as graphs get large.

Strength: The instructor provided sufficient motivation for the subject. His explanation was clear and he tried to make sure that students understood his explanation. The instructor also offered office hours to help us doing the homework.
Weakness: Sometimes the instructor rushed the calculation. The class started at 8am. Nevertheless, I was looking forward to this class every week.

The course was very thorough and covered a vast range of interesting material. Scheduling it for two hours a week, once a week in the morning made it a little difficult to absorb everything, but the teaching and material were great.
I would strongly recommend this course for those who are interested in graphs, random objects, or probabilistic methods.
I think this course is very important to every math major, whether you haven't done much probability and want to develop intuitions for it, or want to take your learning further in a beautiful field.
